com.pgcraft.spectatorplus

Class SpectateAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgcraft.spectatorplus.SpectateAPI

  • public class SpectateAPI
extends Object
    This is the API of SpectatorPlus.

    Use the methods of this class to manage spectators, arenas and everything else.

    • Constructor Summary

      protected SpectateAPI()

      Enables or disables the spectator mode for a player.
      Since this method provides no sender, the console is used by default.
      Consider using setSpectating(Player player, boolean spectating, boolean silent) instead to avoid outputting messages.

    • Method Detail

      • getAPI

        public static SpectateAPI getAPI()
        Used to make access to the API much easier.

        SpectateAPI.getAPI() can now be used to get a reference to the running instance.

        Returns:
        the running instance of SpectateAPI.

      • getSpectator

        public Spectator getSpectator(UUID id)
        Returns the representation of this player for Spectator Plus, with methods to manage spectating-related things around this player.

        The object is created on-the-fly if needed: this never returns null.

        Parameters:
        id - The player's UUID.
        Returns:
        The Spectator object.
        See Also:
        Spectator

      • getSpectator

        public Spectator getSpectator(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Returns the representation of this player for Spectator Plus, with methods to manage spectating-related things around this player.

        The object is created on-the-fly if needed: this never returns null.

        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        Returns:
        The Spectator object.
        See Also:
        Spectator

      • isSpectator

        public boolean isSpectator(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Checks if a player is currently spectating.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check.
        Returns:
        true if the player is spectating.
        Since:
        1.9.2

      • setSpectating

        public void setSpectating(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          boolean spectating)
        Enables or disables the spectator mode for a player.
        Since this method provides no sender, the console is used by default.
        Consider using setSpectating(Player player, boolean spectating, boolean silent) instead to avoid outputting messages.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        spectating - True if the spectator mode needs to be enabled.
        Since:
        1.9.2

      • setSpectating

        public void setSpectating(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          boolean spectating,
                          boolean silent)
        Enables or disables the spectator mode for a player.
        Since this method provides no sender, the console is used by default.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        spectating - True if the spectator mode needs to be enabled.
        silent - If true, will not output any messages - useful when using the API or command blocks.
        Since:
        2.0

      • setSpectating

        public void setSpectating(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          boolean spectating,
                          org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Enables or disables the spectator mode for a player.
        Consider using setSpectating(Player player, boolean spectating, CommandSender sender, boolean silent) instead to avoid outputting messages.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        spectating - True if the spectator mode needs to be enabled.
        sender - The player (or the console) who enabled spectate mode
        Since:
        1.9.2

      • setSpectating

        public void setSpectating(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          boolean spectating,
                          org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                          boolean silent)
        Enables or disables the spectator mode for a player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        spectating - True if the spectator mode needs to be enabled.
        sender - The player (or the console) who enabled spectate mode
        silent - If true, will not output any messages - useful when using the API or command blocks.
        Since:
        2.0

      • teleportSpectatorToPlayer

        public boolean teleportSpectatorToPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player spectator,
                                         org.bukkit.entity.Player target)
        Teleports a spectator to a player.
        The teleportation fails if spectator is not spectating or if target is currently spectating.
        Parameters:
        spectator - The spectator to be teleported.
        target - The target.
        Returns:
        True if the spectator was successfully teleported - spectator was spectating, and target was not.
        Since:
        2.0

      • setSpectatorPlusMode

        public void setSpectatorPlusMode(SpectatorMode mode)
        Sets the current SpectatorPlus mode.
        • ANY: the spectators can teleports themselves to any player in the server.
        • ARENA: the spectators will have to choose an arena; then they will be able to teleport themselves only to the players in this arena. An option is available to prevent the spectators from leaving the arena.
        • WORLD: the spectators will be able to teleport themselves to the players in the same world.
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode.
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        SpectatorMode

      • setConfig

        @Deprecated
public void setConfig(Object toggle,
                                  Object value,
                                  boolean temp)
        Deprecated. Use Toggles directly. This method does nothing.
        Sets a toggle.

        DEPRECATED - does nothing.

        Parameters:
        toggle - The toggle to set.
        value - The new value.
        temp - If true this change will not be saved in the config file.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the toggle is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the type of the toggle is not compatible with the type of the value.
        Since:
        2.1
        See Also:
        Toggles

      • getArenasManager

        Returns the Arenas manager. Use this to manage the arenas.
        Returns:
        The ArenasManager.
        Since:
        2.0

      • setArenaForPlayer

        @Deprecated
public boolean setArenaForPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                             Arena arena,
                                             boolean teleportToLobby)
        Deprecated. Use Spectator.setArena(Arena).
        Sets the arena for the given player.
        Teleports the player to the lobby of that arena, if a lobby is available.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        arena - The arena.
        teleportToLobby - If true the player will be teleported to the lobby (if a lobby is set).
        Returns:
        True if the change was effective (i.e. the arena exists).
        Since:
        2.0

      • setArenaForPlayer

        @Deprecated
public boolean setArenaForPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                             Arena arena)
        Deprecated. Use Spectator.setArena(Arena).
        Sets the arena for the given player.
        Teleports the player to the lobby of that arena, if a lobby is available.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        arena - The arena.
        Returns:
        True if the change was effective (i.e. the arena exists).
        Since:
        2.0

      • removePlayerFromArena

        @Deprecated
public void removePlayerFromArena(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Deprecated. Use Spectator.setArena(Arena) and pass null as argument.
        Removes a player from his arena.
        The player is teleported to the main lobby, if such a lobby is set.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to be removed from his arena.
        Since:
        2.0

      • broadcastToSpectators

        public void broadcastToSpectators(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                  String message)
        Broadcasts a message to all players with spectator mode enabled, and the sender.
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of the message to be broadcasted.
        message - The message to broadcast.
        Since:
        2.0

      • sendSpectatorMessage

        public void sendSpectatorMessage(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                 String message,
                                 Boolean isAction)
        Sends a spectator chat message, from one spectator to all other spectators.
        Includes "/me" actions
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of the message.
        message - The text of the message.
        isAction - If true, the message will be displayed as an action message (like /me <message>).
        Since:
        2.0
